name: Kentucky HIV/AIDS Program
description: The Kentucky HIV/AIDS Program is a state government program operated by the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services, Department for Public Health. The program provides comprehensive HIV/AIDS prevention, testing, and care coordination services throughout Kentucky. Services include HIV testing and counseling, prevention education, case management, care coordination, Ryan White Part B services, and support for people living with HIV/AIDS. The program also coordinates with local health departments and community-based organizations to provide HIV testing and prevention services.
source: Verified from official Kentucky government website, multiple online directories, and government sources
hours_of_operation: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM (state government hours), hotline available 24/7
eligibility: Kentucky residents seeking HIV/AIDS services, testing, or information
cost_information: Free HIV testing and many services available at no cost
notes: Statewide program with regional offices and partnerships with local health departments. Provides toll-free hotline for information and referrals. Coordinates with local health departments and community organizations for testing and prevention services.
